result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
10:14 AM Defendant Theodore M Oliver in court.  Attorney Thomas James in court for Theodore M Oliver.  Prosecuting attorney Abbey Nickolie in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense requests time for defendant to complete classes to comply with the terms of the State's offer.
Court will set a hearing to check on the status of the defendant's enrollment in the classes as well as a further proceedings date in February.
If defendant provides sufficient documentation that the defendant is enrolled and participating in the classes Court may remove the 12/19/22 hearing.
Hearing scheduled for February 3, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Adjourned order to show cause hearing scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Adjourned order to show cause hearing on December 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant to have no VIOLENT contact with victims A & B listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

Court addresses motion to modify bail.
State has no position.
Statements by the Defense.
For the reasons stated on the record the Court grants the motion to modify bond.  Court orders the CAM monitoring condition removed from the conditions of bond.

Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  The Defendant given the Petition for Court Appointed Counsel paperwork in court.
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 10:00 am.
